Replies.Reply: A sleek British sports car talks directly to us in a pixilated, garbled video. He's OUT OF BREATH. Crates are visible behind him. We're in the shadowy bowels of a steel room.
This is Agent Leland Turbo. I have a flash transmission for Agent Finn McMissile.
Finn. My cover's been compromised.
You won't believe what I've found out here.
This is bigger than anything we've ever seen. And no one even knows it exists. Finn, I need backup. But don't call the cavalry - it could blow the operation. And be careful.
Transmitting my grids now. Good luck!
Alright buddy, we're here. Right where you paid me to bring you.
A car? Hey pal, you can't get any further away from land than out here.
Well I got news for you, buddy.
What does it look like, genius? I'm crabbing!
Yeah? And who's gonna make me?
Alright, alright! Don't get your prop in a twist.
What a jerk. Sorry, buddy. Looks like it's the end of the line.
I'm looking for a car.
Exactly where I want to be.
Professor Zundapp?
What are you up to now, Professor?
That's because it's air-cooled.
Not here.
You must try the canapes on the mezzanine!
So the lab boys analyzed the photo I sent? What did they learn about the camera?
This was London's message?
How did we miss that?
Who is it? Has anyone seen the photo yet?
Oh no.
Change of plan. You're meeting the American.
Those thugs down there were on the oil platform. If they see me, the whole mission is compromised.
You are now.
What's the problem, Shiftwell?
So go in!
Time is of the essence, Shiftwell.
It's his cover. One of the best I've seen, too. Look at the detail on that rust. It must have cost him a fortune.
There's probably heat on him. Be patient.
And then we find out who's behind all this.
What is it?
Anyone with him? He won't be alone.
Then this shouldn't hurt at all.
Miss Shiftwell?
I never properly introduced myself.
Who are you with? FBI, CIA?
You're being followed.
Don't worry.
I've taken care of that. Hang on.
Drive forward. Whatever you do, don't stop.
Roger that.
Thanks, old boy!
Hold on, Sid!
Now that's how I like to start the day! You never feel more alive than when you're almost dead.
Finally. Time to see who's behind all this.
Holley.
Holley, in how many makes and models did this type of engine appear?
This seems like a dead end. If there were something in the photo that could narrow this down a bit I'd be a lot happier.
That's something we can track.
Well done, Mater! I would never have seen that.

I know of a black-market parts dealer in Paris, a treacherous lowlife. But, he's the only car in the world who can tell us whose engine this is. Mater, what would you say to setting up an informal task force on this one?
You obviously have plenty of experience in the field.
You're helping me. Please, Mater.
Paris. Tout de suite.
Is there any other way?
Once we're inside, stay close.
Don't talk to anyone. Don't look at anyone. And absolutely, positively no idling. Are we clear?
Mater?
We're not here to go shopping.
There you are.
Mater, get back!
Have you lost your mind?!
Mater! This chap needs a tow. Hook him up.
Allez! Maintenant - vite!
Easy, Tomber. This is her first field assignment - she didn't know you were my informant.
Tomber was doing 20 to life in a Moroccan impound the first time I saved him, if I recall correctly.
Do those parts look familiar, Tomber?
"Lemon?"
Holley, pull up the pictures from the oil platform. I want to know what other type of cars were out there.
Mater, are these cars considered lemons?
And they're all taking their orders from the car behind this engine.
What, Tomber?
Where's this meeting taking place?
Then there's a good chance our mystery engine will be there too.
Holley, contact Stephenson and have him meet us at Gare de Lyon. Good work.
Of course. They must be the heads of the lemon families.
We've got to infiltrate that meeting. It's the only way to find out who's behind all this.
Good job, Miss Shiftwell.
Thank you, Stephenson.
Perfect.
The idea is to keep a low profile, Mater.
And leave the rest to us.
Friendships can be dangerous in our line of work, Mater.
Right. And Miss Shiftwell's is designing iPhone apps.
In the meantime...
You look a little light on weapons.
Get ready, Mater.
You're on any moment now.
He's so good.
Here we go.
Descramble that voice!
What just happened?
Holley?
Where?
Get out of the way! Andate!
No!
That's how everyone sees you. I tell you, that's the genius of it.
We're in London, Mater. Inside Big Bentley.
Don't be a fool, Mater.
When did I... Oh. Mater, I was complimenting you on what a good spy you are.
I know.
Nice try, Mater.
There's no time. McQueen needs your help, Mater.
It's up to you. Go to the pits and get everyone out. You can do that.
We'll be okay.
He wouldn't have left if I'd told him the truth.
What are you doing?
Good job! Quick thinking, Holley!
Drive!
Burn rubber!!
We've got to get to the course.
Miss Shiftwell.
You kids get all the good hardware.
I knew his escape was too easy.
Mater, listen to me. The bomb is on you.
They knew you'd try to help McQueen. When we were knocked out they planted it in your air filter.
Holley. I'll get Zundapp, you help Mater.
Do you really think I'm going to let you float away, Professor?
Turn off the bomb, Zundapp!
You read my mind.
Where's he going?
Hold your fire! He can't disarm it!
Mater, I don't know what you're doing but stand down now!
Mater, he created Allinol.
Mater!
The engine from the photo.
Our satellites picked up an urgent communique.
We couldn't figure that one out either.
We've got another mission, Mater.
Her Majesty asked for you personally, Mater.
Spy or not, you're still the smartest, most honest chap we've ever met.
If there's ever anything I can do for you, just let me know.
What are you doing out here?
Well turn around and go back where you came from.
Not for long.
Hurry, Professor!
--- HIS TIRES sprout a magnetic exoskeleton. He STICKS to the derrick and now DRIVES VERTICALLY UP UP UP...
Too many cars here. Out of my way!
Ah, yes. Very carefully...
This camera is extremely dangerous.
This is valuable equipment. Make sure it is properly secured for the voyage.
Agent Leland Turbo.
It's Finn McMissile! He's seen the camera! Kill him!!
Wunderbar. With Finn McMissile gone, who can stop us now?
So you think.
Allinol by itself is good for you.
But after microscopic examination, I have found that it has one small weakness. When hit with an electromagnetic pulse, it becomes extremely dangerous.
You were very interested in this camera on the oil platform. Now you will witness what it really does.
Fifty percent power.
This camera is actually an electromagnetic pulse emitter.
The Allinol is now heating to a boil, dramatically expanding, causing the engine block to crack under the stress, forcing oil into the combustion chamber.
You may be able to, but after full impact of the pulse, unfortunately, there will be nothing to replace.
That's him. He's the one.
The project is still on schedule.
--- and kill him.
Guten Tag!
He's already here.
A toast! To the death of Allinol and alternative fuel forever!
Yes, sir. Of course.
Allinol must be finished for good.
It's the American spy!
You actually care about that race car. A pity you didn't warn him in time.
Almost there...
Give it up, McMissile!
Ahhhhh!
You. Why didn't my death ray kill you?
Are you all so dense? It's voice-
Oops. Did I forget to mention that it can only be disarmed by the one who activated it?
Deactivate.
I am not the one who activated it.
Here it is, Professor.
You wanted to see this before we load it?
Oh. A TV camera. What does it actually do?
You got it.
Hey, Professor Z!
This is one of those British spies we told you about.
Get to the boats.
Hey. Tow truck.
We'd like to get to our private business here, if you don't mind.
Thank you.
I gotta admit ---
--- you tricked us real good.
--- for the camera.
Could I start it now, Professor?
Roger that, Professor Z.
Roger that.
You gotta be kidding me.
It's that tow truck from the bathroom.
Yeah, the one the American Agent passed the device to.
What about him? He's in the pits!
There he is!
Good, you're up!
Professor Z wanted you to have a front row seat for the death of Lightning McQueen.
Here he comes!
I don't know, Professor.
I didn't do nothin'. Shh! I'm talking to the Professor---
Quiet!
I understand, sir. Yes.
We go to the backup plan.
We snuck a bomb in McQueen's pit!
Don't feel bad, tow truck. You couldn't have saved him.
What, you didn't think we'd take your bullets?
Who's the lemon now, huh?
Yeah. This one we caught sticking his bumper where it didn't belong.
He's getting away!
Got it.
And we don't like being tricked.
Hey, what's so funny?
You talked up a lot of cars last night. Which one's your associate?
What about her? Did you give it to her?
How about him? You talk to him?
How about him? Does he have it?
What is it?
The one from the bathroom?
What about him?
Not for long.
Finn McMissile? But you're dead!
This time I'm gonna make sure you stay dead.
We figured you might stop by.
And just in time!
Not for much longer.
What did you do?
You broke it.
What'd he say?
The next time he makes a stop, instead of saying "ka-chow," he's gonna go "ka-boom"!
Oh, wait. You could have!
That's right! You got nothin'.
--- where he lands on its BOOM, drives UP and LAUNCHES OFF IT where he LANDS - MOVING - onto another deck!
--- PAST the pursuing CARS ---
Mater. Tow Mater, that's who... is here to help you!
Hey, Otis!
Well dadgum, you're leaking oil again. Must be your gaskets. Hey, look on the bright side: This is your tenth tow this month, so that means it's on the house.
Don't sweat it. These things happen to everybody, Otis.
Yeah, but I ain't perfect. Don't tell nobody, but I think my rust is starting to show through.
Not yet.
Yeah, we're so dadgum proud of him.
--- McQueen!
McQueen!
McQueen!
McQueen, welcome back!
You too, buddy.
Oh, man. You ain't gonna believe the things I got planned for us.
You ready to have some serious fun?
Wow. I can't believe they renamed the Piston Cup after our very own Doc Hudson.
Well, Doc would've been real proud of you. That's for sure.
You sure you can handle it?
Just remember, your brakes ain't gonna work on these!
Relax, these train tracks ain't been used in years!
This is gonna be good!
Uh-oh. This ain't gonna be good.
Boy, this was the best day ever!
This new dent!
Shoot, that was nothing. Wait til you see what I got planned for tonight.
That's exactly what I was thinking.
Even better! You, me and Miss Sally going out for supper.
Oh.
Okay.
Yeah, sure. Y'all go on and have fun now.
Good evening.
My name is Mater and I'll be your waiter.
Mater the waiter. That's funny right there.
Well yeah I work here. What'd you think, I just snuck in here when nobody was looking and pretended to be your waiter, just so I could hang out with you?
Now, can I start you two lovebirds off with a couple drinks?
Uh, right. Your usual.
Guido! What's McQueen's usual?
What happened to the dinosaurs, now?
Ha ha! That shows what you know.
Your drinks, sir.
I didn't taste it!
You mean it?
You got it, buddy. Hey, what's that?
Hey! You done good! You got all the leaves!
You're just realizing that? Boy, that jet-lag really done a number on you.
Different than what?
You need help? Shoot, why didn't you just say so? That's what a tow truck does. Hey, looky there, it's Mr. San Francisco!
I'll introduce you.
Look at me -- I'm helping you already!
Hey Mr. San Francisco, I'd like you to meet ---
Excuse me. Can I get a picture with you?
Miss Sally is gonna flip when she sees this. She's Lightning McQueen's girlfriend.
She's a big fan of yours.
You're right. She's a huge fan. She goes on and on about your open wheels here.
I'll go get you one. You mind if I borrow a few bucks for one of them drinks?
Free? Well, shoot, what am I doing here?
I'll take one of them.
Never know which one McQueen'll have a hankering for.
Hey, what you got here that's free?
Oh, same ol', same ol'. What's up with you? That looks delicious.
Uh, a little more, please.
There you go. Now THAT's a scoop of ice cream.
Somebody get me water!
Sweet relief...
Whatever you do, do not eat the free pistachio ice cream. It has turned!
No, thank you. This trip's been amazing.
But wait, I... oh, shoot.
But I never leak oil. Never.
Coming through! Excuse me, leakin' oil. Where's the bathroom? Thank you. I gotta go!
What the...
Sorry ladies!
I never leak I never leak I never leak...
Wowee...
What in the---
Hey, that tickles.
Whatever you do, I would not go in there.
A Gremlin and a Pacer!
No offense to your makes and models, but you guys break down harder than my cousin Betsy after she got left at the ---
--- altar!
Are you okay?
Oh, yeah. Don't let me get in the way of your "private business."
It's to adjust the temperature.
Remember it's in Celsius, not Fahrenheit.
Alright then.
Excuse me, ma'am.
Dadgum pistachio ice cream.
Look out, ladies. Mater's fittin' to get funky!
Well, hello.
Course, Karmann Ghia's weren't the only ones. Besides the Beetles you had your Type-3 Squarebacks, with the pancake motors...
... And before both of them, there's the Type-2 buses - my buddy Fillmore's one of them.
Uh, gee. Don't you think that's a little, uh ---
Well, let's see. Tomorrow I'll be out there at the races.
What's a rendezvous?
A date?!
Well, what's going on is I've got me a date tomorrow.
Well, believe it. My new girlfriend just said so. Hey, there she is.
Hey! Hey lady!
See ya tomorrow!
And he's awesome!
McQueen! It's time to make your move. Get on the outside and show 'em what Doc done taught you.
Wow! Some of them fellers is really loud.
Uh, what?
Is there gonna be cable where you is so I can watch the rest of the race?
Well, all right but I usually like to have a proper detailing done before I meet a lady friend.
Hey, new lady friend? You like flowers?
Stay outside. Gotcha.
What's that? You want me to head toward that ruckus?
Wow! A live karate demonstration!
That was cool! Hey, can I get your autograph?
Hey, where'd he go?
Dadgum, did I miss our date?
Hey McQueen! What happened? Is the race over? You won, right?
doing some sort of karate street performance. It was nutso. One of them even had a flamethrower ---
Going to meet my date.
She started talking to me as a voice in my head, telling me where to go ---
Wait a minute -- I didn't screw you up, did I?
Well, I'm sorry. I didn't mean ---
Maybe if I, I don't know, talked to somebody and explained what happened I could help.
But I'm gonna miss my plane.
Doggone it. This is about my hook, isn't it? I know I should've checked it, but I can't really, look -- it's attached to me.
Hey, I know you. You're that feller from the karate demonstration.
Tow Mater. Average intelligence.
Let's just say I'm triple-A affiliated. You know, I know some karate. I don't wanna brag or nothing, but I've got me a black fan belt.
Hey, you wanna see some moves I made up?
This first one I can reach into a car's hood, pull out his battery, and show it to him before he stalls. I call it, "What I accidentally did to my friend Luigi once."
Look, I probably ought to go. I'm about to miss my flight.
This is First Class service. You don't even have to go through the terminal.
Your karate partners are back here.
Is everything okay back there?
You remember that whole thing about me not stopping no matter what?
I knew I should've done carry-on!
Hey, doggone it. It's my imaginary girlfriend!
Boy I tell you what, you really do want this first date, don't ya?
By the time you read this, I will be safely on an airplane, flying home.
That's the closest I ever been to missing my flight! That was ---
Yow!
I gotta go to a doctor. I keep getting these sharp pains in my undercarriage.
Hey, lemme introduce you two.
This here is Finn McSomething-or-
It's Shiftwell. Holley ---

Well, that's one of the worst engines ever made. It's an old aluminum V8 with a Lucas electrical system and Whitworth bolts. Shoot, them Whitworth bolts is a pain, tell you what. Them ain't metric, they ain't inches...
Well, it's kinda hard to tell from this picture, ain't it?
there'? Wait, you mean secret agents. You guys is spies!
You're pretty.
And so nice.
You might not be happy, but I bet this feller is. See how he's had most of his parts replaced? And see all them boxes over there? Them's all original parts. They ain't easy to come by.
Wait, what?
Well yeah I live right next to one.
I don't know, Finn. I ain't exactly been much help to anybody recently.
Well, okay. But you know I'm just a tow truck, right?
Yeah, two of them sweets for me too, Sid!
You know, I always wanted to be a spy.
Yeah, Finn?
Shopping? What do you mean? Why would I ---
Dadgum.
You gotta be kidding me - they've got everything here. Look at them hoods! I could use a hood.
Sorry fellers, I gotta go.
Excuse me. What are you selling?
Man, there are some great ---
Hey, wait for me!
Sure thing.
Well, a lemon needs parts. Ain't nothing truer than that.
Yeah, you know. Cars that don't ever work right. Lemons is a tow truck's bread and butter. Like them Gremlins and Pacers we run into at the party and the race and the airport.
Is the Popemobile Catholic?
That's where the next race is!
Boy, I'll tell you what. That three-
You never see this many lemons in one town. Unless there's a swap meet, or something.
Hey, how'd you get all them pictures?
Wow, not only is you the prettiest car I ever met, but you the smartest too.
That's a familiar sight.
A Hugo being towed. But he looks absolutely perfect.
Makes sense. If I was rich and broke down every day, I'd hire me to tow me around all the time too.
What?
Ahh!
Boy, I sure wish my friends could see me now.
What? I thought you was supposed to be making me a disguise.
Cool! Hey, computer. Make me a German truck!
Check it out. I'm wearing Materhosen. Make me a monster truck!
I vant to siphon your gas. Now make me a taco truck!
A funny car!
So I just go in, pretend to be this truck.
Hey, what are you doing?
Oh. For a second there I thought you was trying to fix my dents.
Well then no thank you. I don't get them dents buffed, pulled, filled or painted by nobody. They're way too valuable.
I come by each one of them with my best friend Lightning McQueen.
I don't fix these. I want to remember these dents forever.
But my line of work is towing and salvage.
No, I meant for real. I ---
I don't know about this, Finn.
It's just that them guys look pretty tough and --- Wait, did you say "idiot"? Is that how you see me?
I, uh---
Okay, okay. Computer: disguise.
Wow, this place looks like it's made out of gold.
Why is that? What do you mean don't talk to you?
So you want me to stop talking to you. Right now?
Replies.Didascalie: (more talking from Holley which we cannot hear)

Replies.Reply: I have no idea what you're talking about...
...Alexander Hugo, aka "Chop Shop Alex."
Hey, you got a lot of aka's, Alex.
Oh yeah, it's unbelievable.
Uh, of course I ain't leavin'.
McQueen?
No!
Dadgum.
Shoot. I didn't mean ---
Whoa!!
Wait wait! I didn't mean that kind of shoot!
McQueen!
Lemme through! Lemme through!
You gotta let me in! I gotta get through to warn McQueen!
McQueen! McQueen!
McQueen!
McQueen!
McQueen!
McQueen, they're gonna kill you!!
Let me go!
Idiot? Is that how you see me?
Domo arigato!
You done good! You got all the leaves!
Now that's a scoop of ice cream!
I never leak oil. Never.
Wait a minute. I didn't screw you up, did I?
Maybe if I talked to somebody, or---
Bang a gong, get it on!
Holley! Finn! Where are we?
Woaaaah! ---
This... this is all my fault.
But I am, remember? You said so.
I'm not a spy!
I've been trying to tell you that the whole time. I really am just a tow truck.
You were right, Finn. I'm a fool.
He's still alive?
Backup plan??
Dadgum lemons.
Dadgum!
Dadgum! Dadgum! Dadgum!
I gotta get you all out of there!
But I can't, I'm just a tow truck.
What about you guys?
What's everybody on the wrong side of the road for?!
Everybody get out! Get out now!
Hey, what are you guys doing here?
No! Everything's not okay! There's a bomb in here! Y'all gotta get out! Now!
Uh-oh.
Stop right there!
Don't come any closer!
No, I'm not okay. Stay away from me!!
Stay back! If you get close to me, you gonna get hurt real bad!
McQueen, you don't get it. I'm the bomb!
Stay away!
Gotta keep away from McQueen.
McQueen, let go!
No way! You could get hurt!
Yeah, they strapped it to me to kill you as a back-up plan.
Deactivate! Deactivate!
Fellers, listen.
I know what you're going through.
--- but becoming powerful and rich beyond your wildest dreams ain't gonna make you feel better.
I get it. I get it! I know what needs to be done.
What? No, I can't do it. Look, nobody takes me seriously. I know that now. This ain't Radiator Springs.
Thanks, buddy.
Oh, right! Hang on!
Computer!
I need that thing you done before to get me away from McQueen!
Now I need you to do the chute, the second kind not the first!
Okay! Somebody's been sabotaging the racers and hurting the cars and I know who. Oh wait... Your Majesty.
This ain't nothing at all like Radiator Springs.
Okay.
It's him.
I figured it out when I realized you all attached this ticking time bomb with Whitworth bolts. The same bolts that hold together that old British engine from the photograph.
It was you leaking oil at the party in Japan. You just blamed it on me.
Then you're faking it. You didn't convert to no electric. We pop that hood we gonna see that engine from that picture right there.
To make Allinol look bad so everybody'd go back to using oil. I mean, he said it himself with that disguised voice.
Yeah, but what if he found that huge oil field just as the world was trying to find something else?
What if he came up with Allinol just to make alternative fuel look bad?
Now you're talking!
"Sir?" Shoot, you can just call me Mater, Your Majesty. I don't wanna hear none of this "Sir" business.
McMissile, McQueen. Queen?

So there I was: rocket jets going full blast, McQueen hanging on for dear life when suddenly them two nasty lemons come out of nowhere, guns drawed. We was goners. But then out of nowhere, this beautiful spy car swoops in from the sky to save us!
Holley! Finn!
What're you doing here?
Oh, man. Y'all is gonna have a great time. Everybody! This here's Finn McMissile. He's a secret agent.
Don't tell nobody. And this is Holley Shiftwell. She's ---
Explode in a fiery inferno?
Go McQueen!! Whoo-hoo!!!
You're leaving already?
Something tells me you're not talking about souvenir bumper stickers.
But I told you all before. I'm not a spy.
Well, thanks. But as much fun as it was hanging with y'all, this...
This is home.
Well, I sure appreciate that, thank you.
Actually... there is one thing.
Whoo-hoo!!!
Check it out. They let me keep the rockets!
Not if I see you first!
Hey, Mater. Gosh, I'm so sorry. I thought I could make it this time, but...
Smooth like pudding, huh? Ah, who am I kidding? I'll always be a lemon.
Replies.Didascalie: (he tries to start his engine, stalls)

Replies.Reply: You're the only one that's nice to lemons like me, Mater.
But you never leak oil.
Hey, is Lightning McQueen back yet?
He must be crazy-excited about winning his fourth Piston Cup.
Uh, Mater? I'm in no hurry. You don't need to go so fast!
Woaahhhhh!
Halfway to the county line.
I know, I can't believe it either!
Whoa!!!
Thanks, Mater!
Oh, Lightning. Welcome home.
Guido, look! Ferraris and tires!
It's like a date.
Guido don't believe you.
Guido still don't believe you.
Tire pressure is excellent.
Wait, there's more here.
"P.S. Please tell the hotel I didn't mean to order that movie. I thought it was just a preview and I didn't realize I was paying for it.
Guido, your eyes do not deceive you. We are in Italy. We are home!
What? No friends of mine will stay in a hotel in my village. You will stay with my --- Uncle Topolino!
McQueen? Is everything okay?
Mater!
None of his wrenches fit the bolts!
So you got my e-mail.
Guido believe you now.
Good to have you back, honey.
And Sarge is in touch with his friends in the British military.
Is everything okay?
Whoa, honey. You got a nasty dent there.
Don't you worry, sweet pea. My baby Ramone can get that fixed up for you in no time.
Mmm-mmm. That Francesco is fine-
I'm gonna have to go get myself some coolant.
Congratulations, man.
He's got plenty of fuel.
Hey, Luigi. Which way to the hotel, man?
It's organic, man.
If you're worried about your fuel, man, don't. It's perfectly safe.
If you're implying that I switched out that rotgut excuse for alternative fuel with my all-
Tree hugger.
Welcome home, soldier.
Quiet! My program's on.
Uh-oh...
His suspension stats look good.
How do they do it? These are the same ingredients as back home, but it tastes so good.
Tree hugger.
Thanks for the help, Corporal.
Once Big Oil, always Big Oil. Man.
The place wasn't the same without you, son.
Not today, boys!
The Radiator Springs Grand Prix is about to begin! All spectators clear the starting line!
What? Did he go somewhere?
A "valuable" dent? Oh, she's as crazy as Mater.
It's good to be home, everybody.
Mater!
Mater, it's so good to see you.
Well, actually I've got something to show you first.
I know Doc said these things were just old cups, but to have someone else win it just didn't feel right, you know?
Alright, pal. I've been waiting all summer for this. What've you got planned?
Come on, you know who you're talking to? This is Lightning McQueen. I can handle anything.
Uh.... Mater?!
Mater!
Come on, come on! Faster, faster!
Boy, Mater. Today was, uh...
Mater, Mater. Whoa. I was kind of thinking of just a quiet dinner.
No, I... I meant with Sally, Mater.
Mater, I meant it would be just me and Sally.
It's just for tonight. We'll do whatever you want tomorrow.
Thanks for understanding.
Alright, then. See ya soon, amigo!
I can't tell you how good it is to be here alone. Just the two of us.
Mater, you work here?
Oh, yeah. How ridiculous would that be?
Yes. I'll have my usual.
Hey, what's going on over there?
Oh, it's that Italian Formula car.
Wait, why do you know his name? And don't say it like that. It's three syllables, not ten.
What's wrong with fenders? I thought you like my fenders.
Mater?
Those are strong words from a car that is so fragile.
